sense.name: remove cargo or a burden (from)
sense.examples: He unloaded his backpack on the floor and it hit with a thud. Marcy unloaded the truck as soon as she got home. He stated he unloaded 40 bags at the Bethany Lutheran Home.

sense.name: sell or give away something undesirable
sense.examples: The kittens were given to me, my parents would say, unloaded on me, by the cook. He unloaded his shares before the price plummeted and while outside investors were unaware of the company's troubles.

sense.name: give vent to emotions
sense.examples: The victim unloaded her anger on the girl's father. After further conversation, he unloaded even more doubt and questions about what it meant to believe in God. When we got to my office, she unloaded her fears and insecurities.
